title: 'Cattle rustling ring' busted in central Louisiana
content: A Vernon Parish couple and their son are accused of stealing more than $1 million in livestock from markets across Louisiana in what a state agency described as a "cattle rustling ring." Ricky Thompson, 68, and Wanda Thompson, 69, of Pitkin turned themselves in for arrest, but authorities were still looking Friday (June 1) for their 39-year-old son, Justin Thompson, the Department of Agriculture and Forestry said. Between August and October, the family allegedly stole cattle from half of the state's eight public livestock markets. "The cattle producers were protected and received their money from the sale barn," Agriculture Commissioner Mike Strain said. "However, the Thompsons never compensated the sale barn, so these businesses suffered significant financial losses." The thefts occurred in Allen, Avoyelles, East Baton Rouge and St. Landry parishes, the agency said.
